snippet: The investment in the Didi Chuxing ride-hailing app enlarges the American giant’s Asian footprint as it comes under greater scrutiny from Beijing.
abstract: Apple's $1 billion investment in Chinese ride-hailing app Didi Chuxing may signal to Chinese government it wants to back local business; Apple has encountered scrutiny recently, and will probably have to invest more to gain China's approval.

byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and MIKE ISAAC
byline.contributor: Paul Mozur reported from Hong Kong and Mike Isaac from San Francisco. Vindu Goel and Katie Benner contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: The investment in the Didi Chuxing ride-hailing app enlarges the American giant’s Asian footprint as it comes under greater scrutiny from Beijing.

headline.main: Apple’s $1 Billion Investment May Ease Ties With China
headline.print_headline: Apple’s Stake in Chinese App May Ease Ties With Beijing
